channel.title: Server in progress
channel.description:
I'm using this thread to record progress of a server I'm working on. Don't have anything useful or nice to say, don't say it.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:32:31 AM[/size][hr]Started with a TestScape source. I'll probably be replacing most of it.
Edit: Scroll down for progress, change of title.

It just stops everyone from looking identical and gay. :)[/quote]

All you need to do is where you load them from the .dat files, if the save is null, then just show the menu.

item.title: Server in progress
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“I Br3ndan I, post:15, topic:73939”][quote author=Aftermath link=topic=108580.msg1086282#msg1086282 date=1175638309]
And some helper methods.

[code] private String getSkillName(int index) {
switch(index) {
case 0: return “Attack”;
case 1: return “Defence”;
case 2: return “Strength”;
case 3: return “Hitpoints”;
case 4: return “Ranged”;
case 5: return “Prayer”;
case 6: return “Magic”;
case 7: return “Cooking”;
case 8: return “Woodcutting”;
case 9: return “Fletching”;
case 10: return “Fishing”;
case 11: return “Firemaking”;
case 12: return “Crafting”;
case 13: return “Smithing”;
case 14: return “Mining”;
case 15: return “Herblore”;
case 16: return “Agility”;
case 17: return “Thieving”;
case 18: return “Slayer”;
case 19: return “Farming”;
case 20: return “Runecraft”;
default: return “Invalid Skill”;
}
}

private int getSkillIndex(String skillName) {
    for(int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
        if(getSkillName(i).equals(skillName)) return i;
    }
    return -1;
}[/code]

[/quote]

Does this mean, that, when you click on a certain Skill on the ‘Skill’ tab text will pop up, which you can edit?[/quote]

Nah, it’s just something which lets you get the skill name if you know the id.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Aftermath, post:14, topic:73939”][quote author=fr33sc4p3 link=topic=108580.msg1086299#msg1086299 date=1175638574]
i wnt teh sex though
[/quote]

DATS WUT DEY ALL WUNT FRUM ME :mad: :mad:[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 11:16:49 AM[/size][hr]Eh, that’s it for now, I’m bored.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 11:22:37 AM[/size][hr]A better way to do the Stats command, by the way.

public void viewStats(int playerIndex) { client other = (client) PlayerHandler.players[playerIndex]; clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("@dre@" + other.playerName.toUpperCase(), 8145); sendQuest("Statistics", 8144); sendQuest("@whi@------------------", 8147); for(int i = 0; i < other.playerLevel.length; i++) sendQuest("@dbl@" + getSkillName(i) + "@whi@: @dbl@" + other.playerLevel[i], 8148 + i); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }[/quote]

I WNT I KNOW!!

item.title: Server in progress
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

I Br3ndan I:

Clue Scrolls, cool. Are you planning on actually making them work. By making it say riddles etc and eventually giving you a reward. That would be awesome.

Yeah, I’ll get started on that now.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 11:02:56 AM[/size][hr]Something to show a menu from a file. I’m gonna use it to read the clue scroll text.

public void readMenu(String fileName) { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(fileName)); clearQuestInterface(); int lineId = 0; while(true) { String line = in.readLine(); if(line == null) break; line = parseLine(line); sendQuest(line, 8144 + lineId++); } sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); } catch (FileNotFoundException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 11:09:28 AM[/size][hr]Some things for menu scripting.

[code] private String parseLine(String line) {
String colToken = “$isskill(”;
String colToken2 = “);”;

    line = line.replace("$rights", stringRights(playerRights));
    line = line.replace("$name", playerName);
    line = line.replace("$siteaddress", "http://www.rsresources.net");
    line = line.replace("$servername", "Mykom");
    int colorStart = line.indexOf(colToken);
    if(colorStart != -1) { // Color parsing for skills, Aftermath.
        int colorEnd = line.indexOf(colToken2, colorStart);
        if(colorEnd != -1) {
            String colorData = line.substring(colorStart + colToken.length(), colorEnd);
            String[] data = colorData.split(",");
            if(data.length == 2) {
                int skillIndex = getSkillIndex(data[0].trim());
                if(skillIndex != -1) {
                    try {
                        int skillLevel = Integer.parseInt(data[1].trim());
                        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(line);
                        sb.delete(colorStart, colorEnd + colToken2.length());
                        sb.insert(colorStart, playerLevel[skillIndex] >= skillLevel ? "@gre@" : "@dre@");
                        return sb.toString();
                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                        sendMessage("Bad line: " + line);
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }

[/code]

And some helper methods.

[code] private String getSkillName(int index) {
switch(index) {
case 0: return “Attack”;
case 1: return “Defence”;
case 2: return “Strength”;
case 3: return “Hitpoints”;
case 4: return “Ranged”;
case 5: return “Prayer”;
case 6: return “Magic”;
case 7: return “Cooking”;
case 8: return “Woodcutting”;
case 9: return “Fletching”;
case 10: return “Fishing”;
case 11: return “Firemaking”;
case 12: return “Crafting”;
case 13: return “Smithing”;
case 14: return “Mining”;
case 15: return “Herblore”;
case 16: return “Agility”;
case 17: return “Thieving”;
case 18: return “Slayer”;
case 19: return “Farming”;
case 20: return “Runecraft”;
default: return “Invalid Skill”;
}
}

private int getSkillIndex(String skillName) {
    for(int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
        if(getSkillName(i).equals(skillName)) return i;
    }
    return -1;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Server in progress
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Thanks, Br3ndan

An more convenient way to make an ItemDescriptor which only gives one item:

public ItemDescriptor(int itemId) { this.itemId = itemId; this.amount = 1; }

Working on getting Tyras drops like in real RuneScape.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:37:04 AM[/size][hr]ItemHandler adding ItemDescriptor.

public static void addItem(ItemDescriptor itemDescriptor, int itemX, int itemY, int itemController, boolean itemStatic) { addItem(itemDescriptor.getId(), itemX, itemY, itemDescriptor.getAmount(), itemController, itemStatic); }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:53:20 AM[/size][hr]The Tyras Drops, mostly complete.

private static final ItemDescriptor[] tyrasGuardDrops = { new ItemDescriptor(995, 44), new ItemDescriptor(995, 220), /* Coins */ new ItemDescriptor(1311), new ItemDescriptor(1365), new ItemDescriptor(1353), /* Steel 2H, B-Axe, Axe */ new ItemDescriptor(1197), new ItemDescriptor(1073), /* Mithril Kite, Addy Platelegs */ new ItemDescriptor(1163), new ItemDescriptor(1099), /* Rune Full Helm, Green D'hide Legs */ new ItemDescriptor(560, 5), new ItemDescriptor(562, 15), /* 5 Death, 15 Chaos */ new ItemDescriptor(554, 37), new ItemDescriptor(554, 75), /* 37, 75 Fire */ new ItemDescriptor(2357), new ItemDescriptor(1734, 10), /* Gold Bar, 10 Thread */ new ItemDescriptor(985), new ItemDescriptor(987), /* Half Key */ new ItemDescriptor(2366) /* Shield left half, TODO combining ItemDescriptor[]'s, herbs, uncut gems, clue scrolls */ };

The code to get them from outside:

public static ItemDescriptor[] getTyrasDrops() { return tyrasGuardDrops; }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:54:08 AM[/size][hr]Bones. For easy access.

public static ItemDescriptor bones() { return new ItemDescriptor(526); }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:56:07 AM[/size][hr]The code to drop an item for Tyras Guard.

[code] int npcType = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].npcType;
int killer = GetNpcKiller(NPCID);

        if(npcType == 1200) /* Tyras Guard */ {
            ItemHandler.addItem(ItemDescriptors.getOne(ItemDescriptors.getTyrasDrops()), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, killer, false);                      
            ItemHandler.addItem(ItemDescriptors.bones(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, killer, false);
        }

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Server in progress
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Imo everything should be an int.

Aftermath:

It’s easier this way, otherwise it would take extra effort to describe an amount, and this way I can specify NPCs to drop multiple amounts of the same item easily.

Just to let you know incase you weren’t aware, if 2+ of the same item spawns on the same coordinates you will only be able to pick up one of them. E.G You right click, 5 Abbysal Whip’s are luying on the ground, if you pick any 1 of them up the rest will dissapear. Just to let you know, just incase like I said.

Aftermath:

Some code, now if you click on a drawer or crates, a random junk item appears in your inventory. 50% chance of finding nothing.

Sounds cool.

Edit : [quote=“Aftermath”]Thanks, Br3ndan :D[/quote]

No problem.

[quote=“Aftermath”]An more convenient way to make an ItemDescriptor which only gives one item:

Working on getting Tyras drops like in real RuneScape.[/quote]

Good luck with that.

Read full topic

item.title: Server in progress
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Imo everything should be an int.

It’s easier this way, otherwise it would take extra effort to describe an amount, and this way I can specify NPCs to drop multiple amounts of the same item easily.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:02:33 AM[/size][hr]Something to get only one ItemDescriptor from an array.

public static ItemDescriptor getOne(ItemDescriptor[] itemDescriptors) { return itemDescriptors[new Random().nextInt(itemDescriptors.length)]; }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:08:21 AM[/size][hr]Some code, now if you click on a drawer or crates, a random junk item appears in your inventory. 50% chance of finding nothing.

if(objectID == 348 /* Drawers */ || objectID == 358 /* Crates */) { sendMessage("You search the object... "); if(new Random().nextInt(10) < 5) { sendMessage("You do not find anything :("); } else { ItemDescriptor junkItem = ItemDescriptors.getOne(ItemDescriptors.getJunkItems()); sendMessage("You find " + junkItem.getAmount() + " X " + GetItemName(junkItem.getId())); addItem(junkItem); } }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 10:15:14 AM[/size][hr]Just a picture of it working

item.title: Server in progress
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Zenzie:

Reported for spam make a topic when you have something to post …

I do have something to post. Stay out if you do not have anything nice to say.

[quote=“fr33sc4p3, post:3, topic:73939”]Try listing your plans for the server
and zenzie go fux ur self[/quote]

I’m planning on that. Zenzie posted before I got a chance :rolleyes:[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:34:58 AM[/size][hr]New class ItemDescriptor to describe an item in terms of quantity and type.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:39:26 AM[/size][hr][code]public class ItemDescriptor {
private int itemId, amount;

public ItemDescriptor(int itemId, int amount) {
    this.itemId = itemId;
    this.amount = amount;
}

public int getId() {
    return itemId;
}

public int getAmount() {
    return amount;
}

}
[/code]

Just a constructor and some accessor methods so far, but it helps keep stuff organized.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:41:18 AM[/size][hr]A new addItem method to work with ItemDescriptors.

public boolean addItem(ItemDescriptor itemDescriptor) { return addItem(itemDescriptor.getId(), itemDescriptor.getAmount()); }[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:43:44 AM[/size][hr]An ItemDescriptors data class to store some information about common things. I’m starting with the junk items.

[code]public class ItemDescriptors {
private static final ItemDescriptor[] junkItems = { /* Items which can be obtained through
searching normal chests, closets, creates, etc. Useless junk /
new ItemDescriptor(688, 1), / Buttons /
new ItemDescriptor(995, 3), / 3 Coins /
new ItemDescriptor(689, 1), / Broken Staff /
new ItemDescriptor(690, 1), / Broken Glass /
new ItemDescriptor(687, 1), / Broken Arrow /
new ItemDescriptor(686, 1), / Rusty Sword */
};

public static ItemDescriptor[] getJunkItems() {
    return junkItems;
}

}[/code][br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:50:25 AM[/size][hr]Nothing exciting yet. Just some debug info for me so that I can tell what object I click on.

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Aftermath")) { sendMessage("[OBJ " + objectID + "] (" + objectX + ", " + objectY + ")"); }

I’ll get crates, drawers, and chests done when I get the IDs.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2007, 09:55:02 AM[/size][hr]Just another method I forgot, to check if an ItemDescriptor equals another.

public boolean equals(Object other) { return other instanceof ItemDescriptor && ((ItemDescriptor)other).getId() == getId() && ((ItemDescriptor)other).getAmount() == getAmount(); }

Read full topic
